skill.name: python-testing-patterns
skill.description: Implement comprehensive testing strategies with pytest, fixtures, mocking, and test-driven development. Use when writing Python tests, setting up test suites, or implementing testing best practices.
skill.summary: Implement comprehensive testing strategies with pytest, fixtures, mocking, and test-driven developme...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Reviewed all text files in the skill directory. The repository contains only documentation and examples, with no executable scripts. Example code demonstrates network requests, environment access, and file I O, so risk is low and limited to instructional content.

content.value_statement: Writing Python tests can be slow and inconsistent across teams. This skill provides clear pytest patterns and examples to speed test design and improve coverage.
actual_capabilities: Provide pytest unit test examples using the Arrange Act Assert pattern
Show fixture setup, teardown, and scope patterns
Explain mocking with unittest.mock and patch
Introduce property based testing with Hypothesis
limitations: Does not run tests or verify outcomes
Does not inspect your codebase without provided snippets
Does not generate full project scaffolding
Does not install dependencies or configure CI automatically

use_cases.title: Harden unit tests
use_cases.description: Apply pytest patterns to cover core business logic with clear, maintainable tests.

use_cases.title: Standardize test suites
use_cases.description: Use fixtures, markers, and parametrization to build consistent test infrastructure.

use_cases.title: Validate data utilities
use_cases.description: Add unit tests and property based checks for data processing functions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic unit test
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner needs a first pytest test
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a simple pytest test for a function that adds two numbers using the Arrange Act Assert pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Fixture setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pytest fixture for a database client and show one test that uses it with proper teardown.

prompt_templates.title: Mock HTTP call
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a pytest example that mocks requests.get and asserts the URL and parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Async and property tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to test an async function and add one Hypothesis property test for a string utility.

output_examples.input: I need tests for a service that calls an API and caches results
output: Create a fixture for the service with a temporary cache
Mock the HTTP client and assert it is called once
Add a second call test to confirm cached behavior

best_practices: Keep tests isolated and clean up shared state
Use fixtures for reusable setup and teardown
Parametrize tests to cover edge cases with minimal duplication
anti_patterns: Sharing mutable global state across tests
Hitting live external services in unit tests
Asserting many behaviors in one test

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported
faq.answer: Examples target modern Python and pytest, typically 3.9 or newer.

faq.question: What test types are covered
faq.answer: Focuses on unit, integration, async, and property based patterns.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI pipelines
faq.answer: It gives pytest and coverage commands you can adapt for CI.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and example code.

faq.question: How do I get help with failing tests
faq.answer: Share the failing output and a minimal code snippet for targeted advice.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic advice
faq.answer: It provides concrete pytest patterns, fixtures, and mocking examples.
